posts.author: WhisKai
posts.content:
Hello! First time I post in these forums, though I've been checking it for a while.

So, I started playing in a new server, but I'm having a hard time trying to figure out what to play and how to build it.

My request, if possible, would look like...

1) PvM

2) Max level: 20

3) Restrictions:
 
   - Minimum 3 levels of base class before or at level 10. Example: (6 ranger, 4 warrior) or (3 ranger, 3 barbarian, 4 warrior)

   - Roleplay server. That means no less than 10 Wis, Cha, Dex...

   - Minimum 5 levels of prestige classes before level 20. Example: (8 fighter, 3 bard, 9 RDD)

4) Low magic server.

5) Melee preference. Don't really care about class nor alignments. Same goes for weapons. Though I'd rather play an STR char, but not a big deal if it's DEX based.

6) Class changes:

   - Assassin gets HiPS at level 8.

   - Ranger hit point dice changed to d8 but gets 6+int skills. Also gets ITWF at level 6 instead of 9.

   - RDD hit point dice changed to d12.

7) Spellcasting. I've always loved to idea of playing a warrior who could also use magic. There's even a prestige class in this server that's basically that. But tbh it's not a big deal if it won't have any spellcasting, or if it's cleric/druid/whatever. Also, UMD is available to all classes, so even a warrior could spend skill points in it (2:1 ratio).

Lastly, thank you very much for reading and helping. Also sorry if I made some grammar mistakes, English is not my native language.

Have a great day!

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
I'm thinking that what we need is something more specific as to what you want, WhisKai - otherwise the assorted great and good will just keep throwing (albeit good) choices your way.

It's actually like Max says in his guide to building (just don't tell him I recommended it, he'll only gloat) - you need a concept first. What do you want it to do? And how do you want it to do it?

Oh, and welcome!

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
In a low magic environment casters outperform everything, unless they are nerfed by spell changes or ridiculous resting restrictions.
For self buffing melee builds, something with 15 - 20 levels of cleric is my #1 advice.
Good alternatives are bard 16, preferably with fighter, druid with a dash of monk and even the more exotic druid/monk/shifter
If you want something different, you can try a Melee mage, a wizard 20, built to self-buff and melee the mobs and kill bosses with spells. Not something for beginners, though.
